data.title: No. 2 Navy Travels to No. 1 Army West Point for 2024 Patriot League Baseball Championship Series
data.meta_description: BETHLEHEM, Pa. – Top-seeded Army West Point (29-21, 16-8 PL) will host No. 2 Navy (28-21, 15-10 PL) when the best two-of-three-game 2024 Patriot League Baseball Championship Series begins on Sunday, May 19 at Johnson Stadium at Doubleday Field.
data.text:
Mids and Black Knights begin best two-of-three-game series on Sunday afternoon

BETHLEHEM, Pa. – Top-seeded Army West Point (29-21, 16-8 PL) will host No. 2 Navy (28-21, 15-10 PL) when the best two-of-three-game 2024 Patriot League Baseball Championship Series begins on Sunday, May 19 at Johnson Stadium at Doubleday Field.

Live coverage of each game of the 2024 Patriot League Baseball Championship Series will be available on ESPN+, with Corey Nidoh calling play-by-play and Maria Trivelpiece providing analysis.

The five-time defending Patriot League Champion Black Knights aim for their 13th League title and second under head coach Chris Tracz. Navy makes its first trip to the championship series since 2019. The Mids are in search of their seventh League title and first under first-year head coach Chuck Ristano.

The winner of the 2024 Patriot League Baseball Championship Series will receive the League’s automatic berth into the NCAA Division I Baseball Championship. For more information, visit CHAMPIONSHIP CENTRAL.

No. 2 Navy at No. 1 Army West Point (Johnson Stadium at Doubleday Field/West Point, N.Y.)

Date Game Time Coverage Sunday, May 19 Championship – Navy at Army West Point 1:05 p.m. ESPN+ Monday, May 20 Championship – Navy at Army West Point 1:05 p.m. ESPN+ Tuesday, May 21 Championship – Navy at Army West Point 1:05 p.m. ESPN+

2024 Patriot League Baseball Championship – Championship Series

NO. 2 NAVY MIDSHIPMEN (28-21, 15-10 PL) AT NO. 1 ARMY WEST POINT BLACK KNIGHTS (29-21, 16-8 PL)

Johnson Stadium at Doubleday Field/West Point, N.Y. Each game at 1:05 p.m. (ESPN+)

WATCH: GAME 1 | GAME 2 | GAME 3

LIVE STATS

PREVIEWS: NAVY | ARMY WEST POINT

GAME PROGRAM | CHAMPIONSHIP STATS

CHAMPIONSHIP HISTORY: The 2024 Patriot League Championship Series between the Black Knights and the Midshipmen marks the eighth season the rivals will meet in the League Tournament and the fourth time they meet in the championship series. Army West Point claimed consecutive titles over Navy, defeating the top-seeded Mids in three games in 2019 (6-2, 2-4, 4-3). The Black Knights swept the best two-of-three-game series from Navy in 2018 (8-5, 5-3) in Annapolis.

In 2011, Navy won the first meeting between the two rival programs in a championship series, taking two of three games (4-3, 3-6, 5-3). The Mids also swept the first Patriot League postseason meeting between the two squads in Annapolis in 1994 (8-4, 7-6).

The Black Knights took two games from Navy to earn the Patriot League Championship in 2000, winning the final game, 8-7, in 10 innings. Army defeated Navy in the semifinal round of the 2013 Patriot League Tournament before going on to sweep Holy Cross to claim the title. In 15 Patriot League postseason games, Army West Point is 10-5.

2024 ARMY WEST POINT – NAVY REGULAR-SEASON SERIES

March 24 – At Navy 5, Army West Point 2

March 24 – Army West Point 8, at Navy 1

April 26 – At Army West Point 1, Navy 0

April 27 – Navy 2, at Army West Point 0

April 28 – At Army West Point 7, Navy 6

ABOUT THE PATRIOT LEAGUE

The Patriot League is in its fourth decade of academic and athletic achievement, continually demonstrating that student-athletes can excel at both academics and athletics without sacrificing high standards. The Patriot League’s athletic success is achieved while its member institutions remain committed to its founding principle of admitting and graduating student-athletes who are academically representative of their class. Participation in athletics at Patriot League institutions is viewed as an important component of a well-rounded education.
